Chapter.Name: DECLARATION OF DEATH OF MISSING PERSONS

ExternalData.Titlesect: Convention on the declaration of death of missing persons*

EIF.Label: Entry into force
EIF.Labeltext: 24 January 1952 by the exchange of the said letters, in accordance with article 14.

TreatyText.Label: Text
TreatyText.Text: United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 119, p. 99.

TreatyNote.Text: The Conference was convened pursuant to General Assembly resolution 369 (IV)1 of 3 December 1949 and met at Lake Success, New York, from 15 March to 6 April 1950. For the text of the Final Act of the Conference, see United Nations, Treaty Series , vol. 119, p. 99.

In accordance with article 17 (1), the Convention was to cease to have effect on 23 January 1957. However, the Convention was extended as a result of the adoption of the Protocols of 16 January 1957 and 15 January 1967, and remained in force until 24 January 1972 (see chapters XV.2 and XV.3).

Termination.Label: TERMINATION
Termination.Labeltext: 24 January 1972, in accordance with article 1 of the Protocol of 15 January 1967 (United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 808, p. 296.)

Treaty.Footer: XV 1. Declaration of Death of Missing Persons
